page.title: 15PLANTLIFE
page.content: Fields of wheat, barley, rape and pasture are bounded by ditches and hedges consisting of hawthorne, blackthorne, elder, willow, ash, hazel, elm, sycamore and guelder rose with wild clematis, wild hop, white bryony, dog rose, brambles and bindweed. Pollarded willows dominate the river banks with great willowherb, umbellifers and teasels leading down to purple loose-strife and bur-reeds at the waters edge. The slow moving waters support many typical plants. All mature elms have been lost to disease but young elm is common in the hedgerows. Other trees include horse chestnut, lime, and oak in small numbers. Roadside plants include cow parsley, comfrey, knapweed, white campion, field scabious, toadflax, violet, celandine, speedwell and silverweed.
